intro: Ferula karelinii, commonly known as the Karakorum cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Ferula karelinii is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of high-altitude flora.
